myservs
Class DatabaseMethods

java.lang.Object
  myservs.DatabaseMethods

public class DatabaseMethods
extends java.lang.Object

Class that implements all the methods that query the database.

Author:
Antonis Kouzoupis

connect

registerUser

public int registerUser(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String surname,
                        java.lang.String email,
                        java.lang.String password,
                        java.lang.String id,
                        int telephone,
                        java.lang.String address,
                        int postcode,
                        int isadmin)
Method for registering a new user to the database. All checks are made by the Register servlet class.

Parameters:
name - The name of the user.
surname - The surname of the user.
email - The email of the user.
password - The hashed (sha1) password of the user.
id - The unique id of the user.
telephone - The telephone of the user.
address - The address of the user.
postcode - The postcode of the user.
isadmin - A field specifying if the user is administrator or not.
Returns:
result Non zero value at success and zero if it fails.
See Also:
Register

updateUser

public int updateUser(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String surname,
                      java.lang.String email,
                      java.lang.String password,
                      java.lang.String id,
                      int telephone,
                      java.lang.String address,
                      int postcode,
                      java.lang.String oldId)
Method for changing the personal data of a user.

Parameters:
name - The new name of the user.
surname - The new surname of the user.
email - The new email of the user.
password - The new password of the user.
id - The new id of the user.
telephone - The new telephone of the user.
address - The new address of the user.
postcode - The new postcode of the user.
oldId - This is the initial id that the user was given.
Returns:
result Non zero value at success and zero if it fails.
See Also:
ChangePersonalData

updateAdmUser

public int updateAdmUser(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String surname,
                         java.lang.String email,
                         java.lang.String id,
                         int telephone,
                         java.lang.String address,
                         int postcode,
                         int state,
                         java.lang.String oldId)
Method used by the administrator to change the personal data of the user.

Parameters:
name - The new name of the user.
surname - The new surname of the user.
email - The new email of the user.
id - The new id of the user.
telephone - The new telephone of the user.
address - The new address of the user.
postcode - The new postcode of the user.
state - The new state (administrator or regular user) of the user.
oldId - This is the initial id that the user was given.
Returns:
Non zero value at success and zero if it fails.
See Also:
AdminChangeData

Parameters:
userId - The unique id of the user.
Returns:
result Non zero value at success and zero if it fails.

uploadTable

public int uploadTable(java.lang.String title,
                       java.lang.String description,
                       java.lang.String location,
                       java.lang.String userid)
Method for populating the uploads table at database. This methods writes the cases that the users upload to the database server.

Parameters:
title - The title of the case.
description - The description of the case.
location - The directory of the uploaded file at the server.
userid - The id of the owner
Returns:
result Non zero value at success and zero if it fails.
See Also:
Publish

populatePfileTable

public int populatePfileTable(java.lang.String title,
                              java.lang.String comment,
                              int revision,
                              java.lang.String path,
                              java.lang.String owner,
                              java.lang.String commonFileName,
                              java.lang.String realName)
Method for populating the pfiles table of the database. pfiles table holds the personal files of a registered user under a versioning system.

Parameters:
title - The title of the project.
comment - The comment of every revision.
revision - The current revision.
path - The path of the file at the server.
owner - The owner id.
commonFileName - The name of the initial file (when first uploaded) without the revision prefix.
realName - Just the name of the file.
Returns:
result Non zero value at success and zero if it fails.
See Also:
AddProject

uniqueUser

public int uniqueUser(java.lang.String id,
                      java.lang.String email)
Method for identifying if a user is unique.

Parameters:
id - The unique id of the user.
email - The email of the user.
Returns:
exists Returns 1 if a user with the same credentials already exists of 0 if not.
See Also:
Register

uniqueEmailUser

public int uniqueEmailUser(java.lang.String email)
Method for identifying unique users only from their email account.

Parameters:
email - The email account of the user.
Returns:
exists Returns 1 if a user with the same credentials already exists of 0 if not.

Returns:
exists Returns 1 if a user with the same credentials already exists of 0 if not.

identifyUser

public java.lang.String[] identifyUser(java.lang.String email,
                                       java.lang.String password)
Method to identify if a user is registered to the system or not.

Parameters:
email - Given email.
password - Given password.
Returns:
userCredentials[] If user is registered, returns all the data of the user, else returns an empty array.
See Also:
CheckLogin

findFileRevision

public int findFileRevision(java.lang.String commonFileName)
Method to get the personal file's revision.

Parameters:
commonFileName - The path of the initial uploaded file of the same project.
Returns:
revision Returns the revision number of that project.
See Also:
AddProject

getFileAttributes

public java.lang.String[] getFileAttributes(java.lang.String path,
                                            int revision)
Method to get from a specific personal file, all its data.

Parameters:
path - The initial path of the uploaded file.
revision - The version from which we want to take the data.
Returns:
fileAttributes[] If succeed returns an array with the file's data else an empty array.
See Also:
Download

getProjectAttributes

public java.lang.String[] getProjectAttributes(java.lang.String fileName)
Method to get all the data from the specified project.

Parameters:
fileName - The initial path of the first uploaded file of the project (project's distinguished name)
Returns:
projectAtt[] Returns an array with all the characteristics of the project on success, else an empty array.

Method for closing a connection to the database server.

Parameters:
con - The connection object to the JDBC
